sen.j: 伊勢 継子（いせ の つぎこ、宝亀3年（772年） - 弘仁3年7月6日 (旧暦)（812年8月16日））は、平城天皇の妃。
sen.e: ISE no Tsugiko (born 772, died July 6, 812 (old lunar calendar) (August 16, 812)) was the wife of Emperor Heizei.

sen.j: 木工寮伊勢老人（いせのおきな）の娘。
sen.e: She was a daughter of Mokuryo ISE no Okina.

sen.j: 高岳親王（嵯峨天皇皇太子）・巨勢親王・上毛野内親王・石上内親王・斎宮大原内親王の母。
sen.e: She was the mother of Imperial Prince Takaoka (Crown Prince of Emperor Saga), Imperial Prince Kose, Imperial Princess Kamitsukeno, Imperial Princess Isonokami and the highest priestess Princess Ohara.

sen.j: 2歳年少の安殿親王（後の平城天皇）の皇太子時代に早くから入侍した。
sen.e: She entered into court when Imperial Prince Ate (who later became Emperor Heizei) was only at age 2 and was still the Crown Prince.

sen.j: 彼との間に2男3女を産んだ。
sen.e: She begot 2 sons and 3 daughters with him.

sen.j: 平城天皇即位後、大同 (日本)3年（808年）11月に無位から正五位に叙位された。
sen.e: In November 808, after enthronement of Emperor Heizei, she was confermented to Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank); previously, she had no court ranking.

sen.j: 翌年の大同4年5月、河内国の内蔵寮田11町を賜った（但し、継子の死後は再び内蔵寮田とするという条件が付いていた）。
sen.e: In May of the following year, she was given a rice-field 11 cho from uchi-no-kura-no-ryo in Kawachi Province (on condition that the land will be returned to uchi-no-kura-no-ryo after Tsugiko's death).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

In May of the following year, she was given an 11-cho (109,087 square meters) rice field in Kawachi Province which was originally owned by the Kuraryo (the Bureau of Palace Storehouses), on condition that the land would be returned to the Kuraryo after her death.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 810年、薬子の変で高岳親王が皇太子を廃された。

sen.j: 弘仁2年（811年）4月、従四位下で山城国紀伊郡（京都市伏見区・南区 (京都市)・東山区のそれぞれ一部）の田2町を賜った。
sen.e: In April 811, she was given a rice-field 2 cho in Kii County, Yamashiro Province (that straddled Fushimi-ku Ward, Kyoto City, Minami-ku Ward (Kyoto City), and Higashiyama-ku Ward) as Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade).

In April 811, she was given a 2-cho (19,834 square meters) rice field in Kii County, Yamashiro Province (that covered part of present-day Fushimi Ward, Minami Ward, and Higashiyama Ward in Kyoto City) as the Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。
